title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 16 February 2016 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius\_> has quit  
01:57 <Aranjedeath> has joined #xwiki  
05:51 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
06:36 <mflorea> has quit  
07:13 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:36 <Bugendolf> has quit  
07:51 <Aranjedeath> has quit  
08:42 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:44 <ekarlso> has quit  
08:58 <ekarlso> has joined #xwiki  
09:16 <vmassol> good morning everyone  
09:28 <Bugendolf> has joined #xwiki  
09:33 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:20 <mflorea> vmassol: do you know what's with the "Groovy Postbuild" from the "Post-build Actions" section on ci.xwiki.org? I'm adding a new project to ci.xwiki.org and I noticed that an error is displayed "Script1.groovy: 3: unable to resolve class JenkinsPostBuild"  
10:21 <mflorea> I see the same thing on platform job  
10:21 <vmassol> hi mflorea  
10:21 <mflorea> and on other contrib jobs  
10:21 <vmassol> yes I know  
10:21 <vmassol> but it still works  
10:21 <mflorea> ok, I'll leave it like this if it's normal  
10:21 <vmassol> haven't investigated yet  
10:21 <vmassol> yes  
10:21 <mflorea> ok, thanks  
10:23 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
10:25 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
10:40 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
10:40 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:49 <mflorea> vmassol: I need a newer version of maven for my contrib project so I'm going to add a new "Maven Installation" on Jenkins as per https://www.safaribooksonline.com/library/view/jenkins-the-definitive/9781449311155/ch04s06.html#fig-configure-maven  
10:49 <mflorea> "You can configure as many versions of Maven for your build projects as you want, and use different versions of Maven for different projects."  
10:50 <vmassol> doesn't build with what we recommend on http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Building ?  
10:50 <vmassol> ie maven >= 3.0  
10:51 <mflorea> it doesn't, "The plugin com.github.searls:jasmine-maven-plugin:2.0 requires Maven version 3.1.0"  
10:51 <vmassol> ok  
10:51 <mflorea> I need a newer version of jasmine to be able to run integration tests on PhantomJS  
10:51 <vmassol> then I guess you'll need to mention this on the README.md as an excpetion of dev.xwii.org  
10:51 <vmassol> for now  
10:52 <vmassol> you're talking about ckeditor integreation right?  
10:52 <mflorea> yes  
10:52 <vmassol> since we probably want to move this it platform  
10:52 <vmassol> it means we'll need to upgrade our instructions at http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Building  
10:52 <vmassol> to require maven 3.1+  
10:52 <mflorea> yes, when we move it to platform  
10:52 <vmassol> and thus upgrade the maven versions for jenkins too  
11:10 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:12 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:25 <woshilapin> Hi devs, I'm getting an error when installing an extension from the Extension Manager?  
11:25 <woshilapin> "Undeclared namespace in wiki:xwiki"  
11:25 <woshilapin> Any idea what it could be?  
11:40 <vmassol> woshilapin: sorry, no idea  
11:40 <vmassol> are you using the new xwiki.extension.namespaces feature?  
11:41 <woshilapin> Probably not since I don't know what it is...  
11:41 <woshilapin> Let me see a bit  
11:41 <woshilapin> I remember reading that in the release notes, indeed  
11:42 <vmassol> ok so it's not that  
11:45 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:47 <woshilapin> Indeed, look like possibly something related to these kind of namespaces... but I'm on 7.4.1 and it's a feature of 8.0  
12:04 <woshilapin> In any case, the extensions I'm trying to install don't have this property set  
12:10 <woshilapin> haha :-)  
12:54 <vmassol> woshilapin: haha?  
12:55 <woshilapin> Ha, just for the commits, seeing one commit and then a revert of it just a few minutes after  
13:01 <vmassol> ah ok thought you had found the answer to your problem  
14:45 <woshilapin> has quit  
14:56 <msmeria> has quit  
15:44 <vmassol> hi guys  
15:44 <vmassol> I'm debugging http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13105  
15:45 <vmassol> I have the feeling that the issue is in job status and LogQueue  
15:45 <vmassol> it seems we have a memory leak of LogQueue instances  
15:46 <vmassol> basically they keep growing  
15:46 <vmassol> checking code now…  
16:09 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
16:10 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
16:19 <Aranjedeath> has joined #xwiki  
17:19 <sdumitriu> has quit  
17:28 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
17:44 <acotiuga> has quit  
17:46 <Tassoman> has joined #xwiki  
17:47 <Tassoman> Anyone up and awake? :)  
17:50 <vmassol> Tassoman: depends… getting closer to the end of the day for me ;)  
17:50 <Tassoman> @vmassol lol! It's the same for me... for real I'm also a little sleepy  
17:51 <Tassoman> @vmassol can I ask you some help? I'm just started with xwiki administration  
17:51 <vmassol> shoot, even if I cannot answer maybe someone else will  
17:52 <Tassoman> my layout is missing horizontal menu like in xwiki.org website ... any idea how to get it?  
17:52 <vmassol> Tassoman: you can install the menu app  
17:52 <vmassol> go in admin, install extensions  
17:52 <vmassol> search for "menu"  
17:52 <Tassoman> I got it, It's an optional extension!  
17:53 <vmassol> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Menu+Application  
17:53 <Tassoman> Tank you so much!  
17:53 <vmassol> yw  
17:53 <Tassoman> sorry: tanks with flowers XD  
17:54 <vmassol> :)  
17:54 <Tassoman> Is there any extension to engage coworkers to wikiness?  
17:55 <vmassol> you mean some killer extension?  
17:55 <vmassol> or some invitation extension?  
17:56 <Tassoman> Invitation extension is already enabled, before this coworker should be engaged to being wiki people  
17:56 <Tassoman> I think should be a way of life  
17:56 <Tassoman> You see? I would like to override and get rid of sharepoint  
17:58 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
17:58 <Tassoman> @vmassol sadly looks like "menu application" isn't compatible with my version  
17:59 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
18:01 <vmassol> Tassoman: it is  
18:01 <evalica> @Tassoman go to "Show Details" when viewing the Menu application from Extension Manager. Than press at the bottom on "List stable versions" and select your wiki version.  
18:01 <vmassol> you need to pick the right version  
18:01 <cjd> has quit  
18:05 <Tassoman> vmassol, evalica my xwiki is 7.4.1 and its dependency is not satisfied. I chose 7.4 from "List Stable Versions" and then looks like satisfied, It's safe to proceed?  
18:07 <Tassoman> Well, sry maybe my installation is 7.4 and Extension is 7.4.1  
18:07 <evalica> :) yes - if you have 7.4 wiki than you should install the 7.4 Menu  
18:07 <Aranjedeath> has quit  
18:09 <Tassoman> woha! I could handcraft breadcrumbz, lovely wiki  
18:11 <Tassoman> Well I should apply ACL on it and children: view/Menu  
18:28 <Tassoman> vmassol evalica thank you for support! enjoy yourself bye bye! :)  
18:28 <Tassoman> has quit  
18:30 <gdelhumeau> I'm having trouble with new DocumentReference("WebPreferences", spaceReference)  
18:31 <gdelhumeau> it seems correct  
18:31 <gdelhumeau> but when I do toString(), it returns only "WebPreferences" instead of the full path  
18:31 <gdelhumeau> the space is good  
18:31 <gdelhumeau> so I don't understand  
18:33 <gdelhumeau> it make no sense  
18:35 <gdelhumeau> reference.getReversedReferenceChain()reference.getReversedReferenceChain() returns only one element  
18:48 <mflorea> has quit  
18:58 <evalica> has quit
